topic.title: Legacy namecoin-core, why?
topic.body: How come `namecoin-core` from AUR gives you legacy namecoin v0.3.80 instead of the revamped namecoin-core (currently v0.12.0)? The old namecoin doesn't even support IPv6, and the “new” namecoin-core has a lot of added functionality.

1_14TDWFVHuTXNcg8pp6LRr7v9ZcfbFsMSyx.body: The package is now offering the latest `namecoin-core`. Nice!

I don't get why people say there is no wallet features in namecoin-core. I have the latest namecoin-core installed, and namecoin-cli says “Namecoin Core RPC client version v0.12.99.0-20c2dac”. That's the one I use to send wallet commands to namecoind.

1_1FZxKCwPzn7rvLaNi2rE7QHwvyq14XVWzi.body: I've tried Chromium, Midori and PaleMoon. The latter two seem to be faster than Chromium, but Midori currently cannot display ZeroPolls properly.
